hypothesis_content.title: SOL Volatility Surge Post-ETF News Fade
hypothesis_content.statement: Following SOL ETF approval/news surge (1-day return >15%), when 3-day realized volatility peaks above 120% and the price retraces 38.2-50% of the initial move while maintaining elevated spot volumes (>200% of 30-day average), a second volatility expansion will occur within 5-8 days, exceeding the initial volatility peak by at least 15%.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Major crypto news events create volatility regimes that often have multiple phases. The retracement on high volume suggests profit-taking rather than loss of interest. Increasing OI during pullback indicates new positioning. Second volatility expansion occurs as new participants enter and options dealers hedge.
entry_conditions: Price retraces 38.2-50% Fibonacci of initial move
Spot volume remains >200% of 30-day average during retracement

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5-day realized volatility exceeds initial peak by 15% OR price breaks above initial high

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volume declines below 150% of average during retracement OR volatility continues decaying monotonically.
